tp:docstring.p: Observers monitor the creation of new channels. This functionality can be used for things like message logging. All observers are notified simultaneously, and they are not given an opportunity to delay channel handling; they should not alter the state of the channel.
Whenever a new channel is signalled, the channel dispatcher notifies all observers whose ObserverChannelFilter property indicates that they are interested in the channel.
A specification of the channels in which this observer is interested. The ObserveChannel method should be called by the channel dispatcher whenever a new channel matches this description.

For observers that have a .client file, the channel dispatcher may discover this property from the [org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Client.Observer.DRAFT] section of the .client file. (FIXME: what are the keys and their values?)
FIXME: the type 'v' is a placeholder and needs replacing with something suitable.
Called by the channel dispatcher when a channel in which the observer has registered an interest is created.

For observers that are always running, this is somewhat redundant, because the observer could monitor the NewChannel signal. However, observers can also be registered to be started on demand using service activation.
The channel dispatcher SHOULD call this method on all observers at the same time, and SHOULD NOT wait for replies before proceeding. It MAY accept replies asynchronously for logging purposes.

arg.name: Connection
arg.tp:docstring: The Connection with which the channels are associated. The well-known bus name to use can be derived from this object path by removing the leading '/' and replacing all subsequent '/' by '.'.

arg.name: Channel
arg.tp:docstring: The Channel. Its well-known bus name is the same as that of the Connection.
